body: The budget here is **30 mins**, which is exactly how much time will be paid for, when the task is completed
@asinyagin this task is yours, please help (see our key [principles of work](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles)). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here

@yegor256 I have a couple of clarifying questions about the task. Second parameter (50) in the example is the threshold, isn't it? Does a package name com.jcabi.github.wire fit for the class? I need to block a thread due to reset time, am I understand correctly? Do I need to update the site?

The parameter is a threshold. The amount of time to wait depends on github. The class should wait till the moment reported by Github in `X-RateLimit-Reset`.

Yes, I like the package name. Yes, would be great to update Maven site as well.
I would update the site with pleasure, but I don't know how. What exactly should I add to it?

The site is in `src/site`. Would be great to add a new page to `src/site/markdown`, let's call it `respect-limits.apt.vm`. In this page we can explain how Github limits can be explained using our new class. Briefly, with a short example.

Then, a link to this page should be added in `src/site/site.xml`. Try it and I'll correct you if it goes wrong.

@yegor256 I can't think up how to test CarefulWire's sleeping and logging. The first problem is that a CarefulWire object is created inside a Request object and I can't spy or mock anything. The second problem is that Logger is a singleton and hides everything inside itself, so I can't mock it too. May you help me with that?

Hm.. shouldn't be easy, I think. You just make an mock of `Wire`, and pass it as a first argument to `CarefulWire`. Then, ask your careful wire to process a request and see how it interacts with the encapsulated mock. Waiting shouldn't be a problem, since your mock will control for how long careful wire should wait. Logging is not important, and doesn't need to be tested

issue.title: Issue #107

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
Issue #107.

@yegor256 I don't realize how to generate a site to test a new page. May you help me with that? Also, I had troubles with qulice's warning `UseConcurrentHashMap` in a file CarefulWireTest.java. `@checkstyle` didn't help.

body: Pull request for this issue has been merged. I think the issue should be closed.
@asinyagin **30 mins** was added to your account, many thanks for your contribution!
